from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from pyspark.sql.window import Window
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
import logging

# Configure logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')
logger = logging.getLogger()

# Initialize Spark session with optimized configuration for joins
spark = SparkSession.builder \
    .appName("Court Location Mapping") \
    .config("spark.sql.shuffle.partitions", "200") \
    .config("spark.sql.autoBroadcastJoinThreshold", "100MB") \
    .getOrCreate()

def map_court_locations_inner_join():
    """
    Maps the court locations by updating loc_code in voters table
    based on matching LOCAL_AUTHORITY_CODE to rec_num,
    using an inner join to prevent duplicates.
    """
    try:
        # Initialize storage paths
        storage_account = "baubaisadfsastg"
        voters_source_path = f"abfss://juror-etl@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_deduplicated"
        mapping_csv_path = f"abfss://juror-etl@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/config/la_code_tbl/tbl_lacodeToRecNum.csv"
        output_path = f"abfss://eric-juror-schema@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/tbl_eric_voters"
        
        # Read voters data
        logger.info(f"Reading voters data from {voters_source_path}")
        voters_df = spark.read.parquet(voters_source_path)
        original_count = voters_df.count()
        logger.info(f"Loaded {original_count} voter records")
        
        # Read the court location mapping CSV
        logger.info(f"Reading court location mapping from {mapping_csv_path}")
        mapping_df = spark.read.option("header", "true") \
                             .option("inferSchema", "true") \
                             .csv(mapping_csv_path)
        
        # Print column names from both dataframes for debugging
        logger.info(f"Voter dataframe columns: {voters_df.columns}")
        logger.info(f"Mapping dataframe columns: {mapping_df.columns}")
        
        # Ensure data types match for join
        voters_df = voters_df.withColumn("rec_num", col("rec_num").cast("string"))
        mapping_df = mapping_df.withColumn("LOCAL_AUTHORITY_CODE", col("LOCAL_AUTHORITY_CODE").cast("string"))
        
        # Rename the LOC_CODE column in mapping_df to avoid ambiguity
        mapping_df = mapping_df.withColumnRenamed("LOC_CODE", "mapping_loc_code")
        
        # Broadcast the mapping table since it's likely much smaller
        from pyspark.sql.functions import broadcast
        
        # Perform the join to update loc_code - USING INNER JOIN
        logger.info("Performing INNER JOIN based on rec_num = LOCAL_AUTHORITY_CODE")
        joined_df = voters_df.alias("v").join(
            broadcast(mapping_df.alias("m")),
            col("v.rec_num") == col("m.LOCAL_AUTHORITY_CODE"),
            "inner"  # Only keep records with matches
        )
        
        # Select columns, replacing loc_code with mapping_loc_code
        selected_columns = []
        for column in voters_df.columns:
            if column == "loc_code":
                selected_columns.append(col("m.mapping_loc_code").alias("loc_code"))
            else:
                selected_columns.append(col(f"v.{column}"))
        
        final_df = joined_df.select(*selected_columns)
        
        # Check for duplicates in the result
        hash_id_duplicate_check = final_df.groupBy("hash_id").count().filter(col("count") > 1)
        hash_id_duplicate_count = hash_id_duplicate_check.count()
        
        if hash_id_duplicate_count > 0:
            logger.warning(f"Found {hash_id_duplicate_count} distinct hash_id values with duplicates in result")
            logger.info("Applying deduplication based on hash_id")
            
            # Apply deduplication to keep only one record per hash_id
            window_spec = Window.partitionBy("hash_id").orderBy(desc("creation_date"))
            final_df = final_df.withColumn("row_num", row_number().over(window_spec)) \
                            .filter(col("row_num") == 1) \
                            .drop("row_num")
        
        # Get final record count
        final_count = final_df.count()
        logger.info(f"Final record count after mapping: {final_count}")
        logger.info(f"Records retained from original: {final_count}/{original_count} ({final_count/original_count:.2%})")
        
        # Write the updated data
        logger.info(f"Writing mapped data to {output_path}")
        final_df.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(output_path)
        
        # Verify successful write
        if mssparkutils.fs.exists(output_path):
            logger.info(f"Successfully wrote {final_count} records with updated court location mappings")
            
            # Check the output for duplicates
            output_df = spark.read.parquet(output_path)
            output_duplicates = output_df.groupBy("hash_id").count().filter(col("count") > 1).count()
            
            if output_duplicates > 0:
                logger.error(f"Warning: Found {output_duplicates} duplicate hash_id values in output file")
            else:
                logger.info("Verified: No duplicate hash_id values in output file")
                
            return True
        else:
            logger.error("Failed to write mapped data to destination")
            return False
            
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error in court location mapping process: {str(e)}")
        import traceback
        logger.error(traceback.format_exc())
        return False

# Execute the mapping
if __name__ == "__main__":
    success = map_court_locations_inner_join()
    if success:
        print("Court location mapping completed successfully using inner join")
    else:
        print("Court location mapping failed")
